metadata.title: CVE-2017-15018 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
LAME 3.99.5, 3.99.4, 3.99.3, 3.99.2, 3.99.1, 3.99, 3.98.4, 3.98.2 and 3.98have a heap-based buffer over-read when handling a malformed file in k_34_4in vbrquantize.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lame - 3.100-2
libmp3lame0 - 3.100-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lame package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.100-2').
